definition: father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)

sentences.english: And David was then in an hold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 那时大卫在山寨，非利士人的防营在伯利恒。

sentences.english: Thousands of people have attended Christmas Eve celebrations at the birthplace of Christianity in Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 数千人在基督教诞生地伯利恒参加圣诞夜庆祝活动。

sentences.english: David was still a youth when Samuel anointed David to be King in the town of Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 大卫还年轻时撒母耳在伯利恒城膏立他为王。

sentences.english: Fill your horn with oil and be on your way; I am sending you to Jesse of Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 你将膏油盛满了角，我差遣你往伯利恒人耶西那里去。

sentences.english: Slouches towards Bethlehem to be born?
sentences.chinese: 懒散的踏向伯利恒的投生？

sentences.english: Now David was the son of an Ephrathite named Jesse, who was from Bethlehem in Judah.
sentences.chinese: 大卫是犹大，伯利恒的以法他人耶西的儿子。

sentences.english: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 那时大卫在山寨，非利士人的防营在伯利恒。

sentences.english: Sales of small inexpensive gifts "Gala" Christmas in Bethlehem and in "bulk.
sentences.chinese: 小便宜的圣诞礼物销售的散装和在伯利恒。

sentences.english: And they took up Asahel, and buried him in the sepulchre of his father, which was in Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 众人将亚撒黑送到伯利恒，葬在他父亲的坟墓里。

sentences.english: And they took up Asahel and buried him in the tomb of his father, which was at Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 众人将亚撒黑送到伯利恒，葬在他父亲的坟墓里。

sentences.english: To distinguish it from Bethlehem in the territory of Zebulon.
sentences.chinese: 西布伦的伯利恒外的土地。

sentences.english: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet
sentences.chinese: 他们回答说，在犹太的伯利恒。

sentences.english: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and make a careful search for the child.
sentences.chinese: 就差他们往伯利恒去，说，你们去仔细寻访那小孩子。

sentences.english: May you have standing in Ephrathah and be famous in Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 又愿你在以法他得亨通，在伯利恒得名声。

sentences.english: The children of Bethlehem, an hundred twenty and three.
sentences.chinese: 伯利恒人一百二十三名。

sentences.english: The Israelis have no time for sentimentality about Bethlehem either.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人也没时间因为伯利恒而多愁善感。

definition: Herod the Great (73 BC - 4 BC), Roman-appointed king of Judea (37-4 BC)
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
